goal.core.program.validation

Class Validator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.program.validation.Validator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The validator type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionComboValidator, ActionSpecificationValidator, ActionValidator, GOALProgramValidator, MASProgramValidator, ModuleValidator, NameSpaceValidator, RuleSetValidator, RuleValidator

    public abstract class Validator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic structure for a validator. The intended structure for subclasses is as follows:
    - Create a subclass for each type of object to be validated, with custom code for doValidate(T) in each of them.
    - If an object to be validated contains (links to) other objects to be validated, call validate(T, boolean) on a validator for that object. Then call reportToSuperior(goal.core.program.validation.Validator<?>) to copy over any found errors and warnings.
    - It is usually preferred not to stop once such a subordinate validator encountered errors, but not mandatory.
    - Try to call validators for child-/sub-objects in such an order that the reason an error occurred may only be because of earlier validated objects.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink

    • Field Detail

      • mod2g

        protected boolean mod2g
        True if we are validating a mod2g (or other external) file

    • Constructor Detail

      • Validator

        protected Validator()
        Create a new Validator. Does nothing; the error and warning lists are initialized by calling validate(T, boolean) (or initialize(), which is called by validate(T, boolean)).

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public final boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the object this Validator last checked did not generate any errors.
        Returns:
        true if no errors have been found while checking the object using #validate().

      • isPerfect

        public boolean isPerfect()
        Checks whether the object this Validator last checked did not generate any errors and/or warnings.
        Returns:
        true if no errors or warnings were generated during the last call of validate(T, boolean).

      • validate

        public boolean validate(T subject,
               boolean mod2g)
        Validates a certain object.
        Multiple objects can be validated with this validator, but information about previously validated objects is lost once a new one is validated.
        Parameters:
        subject - The object to validate.
        mod2g - True if we are validating a mod2g (or other external) file
        Returns:
        true iff the given object is 'perfect'. That is, if no errors or warnings were reported while validating the object. Note that this also returns false if the given object is valid but still has some warnings.

      • doValidate

        protected abstract void doValidate(T subject)
        Does the actual validation of an object. validate(T, boolean) also handles initialization and the 'perfectness'-check afterwards.
        Parameters:
        subject - The object to validate.

      • report

        protected void report(ValidatorMessage problem)
        Reports a problem {ValidatorMessage) that was found while validating.
        Parameters:
        problem - The problem that was found while validating; type of the problem reported must be either a ValidatorWarning or a ValidatorError.

      • getErrors

        public java.util.List<ValidatorError> getErrors()
        Returns:
        The resulting errors (if any).

      • getWarnings

        public java.util.List<ValidatorWarning> getWarnings()

      • getAllReports

        public java.util.List<ValidatorMessage> getAllReports()
        Returns:
        The resulting errors and/or warnings (if any).

      • reportToSuperior

        public void reportToSuperior(Validator<?> superior)
        Reports any errors and warnings found to another validator.
        Parameters:
        superior - The Validator to report the found errors and warnings to.
